content.question: Directions: Imagine that you are making an oral presentation to your Japanese class. First, you will hear and read the topic for your presentation. The time you will have to prepare your presentation is indicated on the clock. You will then have 2 minutes to record your presentation. Your presentation should be as complete as possible.Present your own view or perspective on family activities in Japan. Discuss at least FIVE aspects or examples of family activities in Japan.Begin with an appropriate introduction, give details, explain your own view or perspective, and end with a concluding remark.
